actor_awards.notes: Best known for playing Jane in the Tarzan film series opposite Johnny Weissmuller. She is the mother of actress Mia Farrow. She received a Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in 1991.

filmography.title: Tarzan the Ape Man
filmography.role_description: An Englishwoman who travels to Africa to find her father and falls in love with a man raised by apes.
filmography.plot: A trader and his daughter set off in search of the fabled Elephant's Graveyard, only to encounter a wild man raised by apes.

filmography.title: The Thin Man
filmography.role_description: The daughter of a missing inventor who asks Nick Charles to help find her father.
filmography.plot: A former detective and his wealthy wife investigate a murder case involving an eccentric inventor and his dysfunctional family.

filmography.title: Tarzan and His Mate
filmography.role_description: Jane now lives in the jungle with Tarzan, facing threats from ivory hunters and safari expeditions.
filmography.plot: The idyllic life of Tarzan and Jane is threatened by men on a safari who want to take Jane back to civilization.

filmography.title: Hannah and Her Sisters
filmography.role_description: The boozy, flirtatious mother of the three sisters, a former actress who still craves the spotlight.
filmography.plot: Between two Thanksgivings two years apart, Hannah's husband falls in love with her sister Lee, while her hypochondriac ex-husband rekindles his relationship with her sister Holly.

filmography.title: David Copperfield
filmography.role_description: The sweet but flighty and impractical first wife of David Copperfield.
filmography.plot: A gentle orphan discovers life and love in an indifferent adult world.

filmography.title: A Day at the Races
filmography.role_description: The owner of a struggling sanitarium who hires Dr. Hackenbush to save her business.
filmography.plot: A veterinarian posing as a doctor, a racehorse owner, and his friends struggle to keep a sanitarium open with the help of a misfit horse.

filmography.title: Pride and Prejudice
filmography.role_description: The eldest and most beautiful Bennet sister, known for her gentle nature.
filmography.plot: Mrs. Bennet is frantic to marry off her five daughters to wealthy men, particularly the new arrivals in the neighborhood.

filmography.title: Anna Karenina
filmography.role_description: The young princess who finds happiness with Levin after being rejected by Vronsky.
filmography.plot: A married Russian aristocrat enters into a life-changing affair with the affluent Count Vronsky.
filmography.awards: Venice Film Festival: Win – Best Foreign Film

filmography.title: The Big Clock
filmography.role_description: The patient wife of a magazine editor who finds his workaholic tendencies straining their marriage.
filmography.plot: A magazine tycoon commits a murder and frames an innocent man, who must then lead the investigation to clear his name.

filmography.title: A Yank at Oxford
filmography.role_description: An English bookstore assistant who catches the eye of an arrogant American student.
filmography.plot: A cocky American track athlete gets a scholarship to Oxford University, where he clashes with British customs and students.

filmography.title: Tarzan Escapes
filmography.role_description: Jane is targeted by a hunter who wants to capture Tarzan for a circus.
filmography.plot: Tarzan is taken prisoner by a big-game hunter who wants to put him on display in England.

filmography.title: Tarzan Finds a Son!
filmography.role_description: Jane becomes a mother figure when she and Tarzan adopt a baby found in a plane crash.
filmography.plot: Tarzan and Jane adopt a boy who survived a plane crash, but his relatives come looking for him.

filmography.title: The Barretts of Wimpole Street
filmography.role_description: The rebellious younger sister of Elizabeth Barrett who defies their tyrannical father.
filmography.plot: The invalid poetess Elizabeth Barrett defies her tyrannical father to marry the dashing poet Robert Browning.

filmography.title: Peggy Sue Got Married
filmography.role_description: The grandmother of the main character, appearing in the 1960 timeline.
filmography.plot: A woman faints at her high school reunion and wakes up in 1960, giving her the chance to relive her youth.

filmography.title: The Devil-Doll
filmography.role_description: The daughter of a man wrongly convicted who uses a shrinking formula for revenge.
filmography.plot: An escaped convict uses a scientist's discovery to turn people into doll-sized creatures to get revenge on those who framed him.
filmography.awards: Venice Film Festival: Nomination – Mussolini Cup

filmography.title: Tarzan's New York Adventure
filmography.role_description: Jane travels to New York City with Tarzan to rescue their son who has been kidnapped to perform in a circus.
filmography.plot: Tarzan and Jane go to New York City to rescue their son, Boy, who has been kidnapped by circus operators.

filmography.title: Cardinal Richelieu
filmography.role_description: A ward of Cardinal Richelieu who falls in love with a Huguenot.
filmography.plot: Cardinal Richelieu maneuvers to protect King Louis XIII and France from enemies both foreign and domestic.

filmography.title: Never Too Late
filmography.role_description: A middle-aged woman who discovers she is pregnant at the same time as her adult daughter.
filmography.plot: A middle-aged couple discovers they are going to have a baby, causing chaos in their family and town.

filmography.title: Where Danger Lives
filmography.role_description: The girlfriend of a doctor who gets involved with a mentally unstable femme fatale.
filmography.plot: A doctor falls for a patient who involves him in the death of her husband, leading them to flee to Mexico.

filmography.title: Bonzo Goes to College
filmography.role_description: The mother of the family that adopts the intelligent chimpanzee Bonzo.
filmography.plot: A chimp runs away from a carnival and ends up becoming the star quarterback for a college football team.

filmography.title: Strange Interlude
filmography.role_description: The rival for the affections of the protagonist's husband in this adaptation of Eugene O'Neill's play.
filmography.plot: A woman marries a man she doesn't love to provide a father for her child, whose real father is a doctor with a family history of insanity.

filmography.title: Payment Deferred
filmography.role_description: The daughter of a man who commits a murder to pay his debts.
filmography.plot: A man desperate for money murders a wealthy relative and buries him in the backyard, but guilt and fear consume him.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: The Crowd Roars
filmography.role_description: The girlfriend of a boxer who tries to keep him on the straight and narrow.
filmography.plot: A choir singer becomes a boxer to pay off his father's gambling debts but gets mixed up with the mob.

filmography.title: Let Us Live
filmography.role_description: A waitress who fights to prove the innocence of her fiancé and his friend, who are wrongly accused of murder.
filmography.plot: Two innocent men are sentenced to death for a robbery-murder they didn't commit, and their fiancées race to find the real killers.

filmography.title: Tarzan's Secret Treasure
filmography.role_description: Jane tries to protect her family and the secret of gold in the jungle from greedy explorers.
filmography.plot: An expedition discovers gold on Tarzan's escarpment and kidnaps Jane and Boy to force Tarzan to reveal the location.
